name: Blindsight, 5-Ft. Radius
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Using senses such as acute hearing and sensitivity to vibrations, you detect the location of opponents who are no more than 5 feet away from you. <i>Invisibility</i> and <i>darkness</i> are irrelevant, though it you discern incorporeal beings.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Disguise Spell
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> You have mastered the art of casting spells unobtrusively, mingling verbal and somatic components into its music and performances so that others rarely catch you in the act of casting a spell. Like a silent, stilled spell, a disguised spell can't be identified through Spellcraft. Your performance is obvious to everyone in the vicinity, but the fact that you are casting a spell isn't. Unless the spell visibly emanates from you or observers have some other means of determining its source, they don't know where the effect came from. A disguised spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Divine Might
prerequisite: Str 13, turn or rebuke undead ability, Power Attack.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> As a free action, spend one of your turn or rebuke undead attempts to add your Charisma bonus to your weapon damage for 1 full round.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Divine Vengeance
prerequisite: Ability to turn undead, Extra Turning.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> You can spend one of your turn undead attempts to add 2d6 points of sacred energy damage to all your successful melee attacks against undead until the end of your next action. This is a supernatural ability.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Energy Substitution
choice: One type of energy: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic
prerequisite: Any other metamagic feat, Knowledge (arcana) 5 ranks.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> You choose one type of energy: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. When employing a spell with the acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic designator, you can modify the spell to use your chosen type of energy instead. The altered spell uses a spell slot of the spell's normal level.</p><p>The altered spell works normally in all respects except the type of damage dealt.</p>
</div>
special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Each time the feat applies to a different type of energy.

name: Extra Music
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> You can use your bardic music four extra times per day.</p>
</div>
normal: Bards without the Extra Music feat can use bardic music once per day per level.
special: You can gain this feat multiple times, adding another four uses of bardic music each time.

name: Eyes in the Back of Your Head
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Attackers do not gain the usual +2 attack bonus when flanking you. This feat grants no effect whenever you are attacked without benefit of your Dexterity modifier to AC, such as when you are flat-footed or when you are the target of a rogue's sneak attack.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Fleet of Foot
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> When running or charging, you can make a single direction change of 90 degrees or less. You can't use this feat while wearing medium or heavy armor, or when carrying a medium or heavy load.  If you are charging, you must move in a straight line for 10 feet after the turn to maintain the charge.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, you can run or charge only in a straight line.

name: Hold the Line
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> You may make an attack of opportunity against a chagin opponent who enters an atea you threaten.  Your attack of opportunity happens immediately before the charge attack is resolved.</p>
</div>
normal: You only get an attack of opportunity against a character that exits a square you threaten.

name: Jack of all Trades
prerequisite: You must be at least 6th level.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> You can use any skill untrained, even those that normally require training.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Knock-Down
prerequisite: Base attack bonus +2, Improved Trip, Str 15.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Whenever you deal 10 or more points of damage to your opponent in melee, you make a trip attack as a free action against the same target.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Persistent Spell
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> A persistent spell has a duration of 24 hours. The persistent spell must have a personal range or a fixed range. Spells of instantaneous duration cannot be affected by this feat, nor can spells whose effects are discharged.  You need not concentrate on spells such as <i>detect magic</i> or <i>detect thoughts</i> to be aware of the mere presence of absence of the things detected, but you must still concentrate to gain additional information as normal.  Concentration on such a spell is a standard action that does not provoke an attack of opportunity.  A persistent spell uses up a spell slot six levels higher than the spell's actual level.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Plant Control
prerequisite: Plant Defiance, ability to cast speak with plants.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> You can rebuke or command plant creatures as an evil cleric rebukes undead. To command a plant, you must be able to speak with it via a <i>speak with plants</i> effect, though it may do so mentally if desired. This ability is usable a total number of times per day equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier. You use your highest caster level to determine the level at which you rebuke plants.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Plant Defiance
prerequisite: Ability to cast detect animals or plants.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> You can turn (but not destroy) plant creatures as a good cleric turns undead. When determining the result of a turning attempt, treat all destruction results as normal turning. Treat immobile plant creatures as creatures unable to flee. This ability is usable a total number of times per day equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier. You use your highest caster level to determine the level at which you turns plants.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Power Critical
prerequisite: Weapon focus (chosen weapon), base attack bonus +4
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> When using the weapon you selected, you gain a +4 bonus on the roll to confirm a threat.</p>
</div>
special: A fighter may select Power Critical as one of his fighter bonus feats.You can gain Power Critical multiple times. Each time you take the feat, it may be with a different weapon or the same weapon. If you take it with the same weapon, the effects of the feats stack.

name: Reach Spell
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> You may cast a spell that normally has a range of touch at any distance up to 30 feet. The spell effectively becomes a ray, so you must succeed at a ranged touch attack to bestow the spell upon the recipient. A reach spell uses up a spell slot two levels higher than the spell's actual level.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Repeat Spell
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> A repeated spell is automatically cast again at the beginning of your next round of actions. No matter where you are, the secondary spell originates from the same location and affects the same area as the primary spell. If the repeated spell designates a target, the secondary spell retargets the same target if the target is within 30 feet of its original position; otherwise the secondary spell fails to go off. A repeated spell uses up a spell slot three levels higher than the spell's actual level. Repeat Spell cannot be used on spells with a range of touch.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Sacred Spell
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Half of the damage dealt by a sacred spell results directly from divine power and is therefore not subject to being reduced by protection from energy or similar magic. The other half of the damage dealt by the spell is as normal. A sacred spell uses up a spell slot two levels higher than the spell's actual level. Only divine spells can be cast as sacred spells.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Sharp-Shooting
prerequisite: Point Blank Shot, Precise Shot, base attack bonus +3.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Your targets only receive a +2 bonus to Armor class due to cover.  This feat has no effect against foes with no cover or total cover.</p>
</div>
normal: Cover normally gives a +4 bonus to AC.
special: A fighter may select Sharp-Shooting as one of his bonus feats.

name: Subdual Substitution
prerequisite: Any other metamagic feat, Knowledge (arcana) 5 ranks.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> When employing a spell with the acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic designator, you can modify the spell to deal subdual damage instead of the indicated type of energy damage. The altered spell uses a spell slot of the spell's normal level.</p><p>The altered spell works normally in all respects except the type of damage dealt.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Superior Expertise
prerequisite: Int 13, Combat Expertise, base attack bonus +6.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> When you use the Combat Expertise feat to improve your Armor Class, the number you subtract from your attack and add to your AC can be any number that does not exceed your base attack bonus.</p><p>This feat eliminates the +5 maximum for the Combat Expertise feat.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Additional Magic Item Space
choice: One type of magic item that has a limit on the number a character can simultaneously wear and gain its benefit
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Choose one type of magic item that has a limit on the number a character can simultaneously wear and gain its benefit. The character can now wear one more magic item of this type and also gain its benefit.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, a character is limited to one headband, hat, or helmet; one pair of eye lenses or goggles; one cloak, cape, or mantle; one amulet, brooch, medallion, necklace, periapt, or scarab; one suit of armor; one robe; one vest, vestment, or shirt; one pair of bracers or bracelets; one pair of gloves or gauntlets; two rings; one belt; and one pair of boots.
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time the character takes the feat, it applies to a new type of wearable magic item.

name: Armor Skin
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character gains a +1 natural armor bonus to Armor Class, or his or her existing natural armor bonus increases by 1.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Augmented Alchemy
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Whenever creating an alchemical item or substance, the character can choose to make it more powerful than normal by adding +20 to the DC required to create it and multiplying its price by 5. If the item or substance deals damage, double the damage dealt. If the item or substance doesn't deal damage, double the duration of its effect. If the item or substance doesn't deal damage and doesn't have a specific listed duration (or has an instantaneous duration), double all dimensions of its area. If the item or substance doesn't fit any of these categories, then it cannot be affected by this feat. See the Craft (alchemy) skill description.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Automatic Quicken Spell
prerequisite: Quicken Spell, Spellcraft 30 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level arcane or divine spells.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character may cast all 0-, 1st-, 2nd-, and 3rd-level spells as quickened spells without using higher-level spell slots. The normal limit to the number of quickened spells a character may cast per round applies. Spells with a casting time of more than 1 full round can't be quickened.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time a character takes the feat, the spells of his or her next three lowest spell levels can now be quickened with no adjustment to their spell slots. This feat doesn't increase the casting time for those spells that normally become full-round actions when cast in metamagic form.

name: Automatic Silent Spell
prerequisite: Silent Spell, Spellcraft 24 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level arcane or divine spells.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character may cast all 0-, 1st-, 2nd-, and 3rd-level spells as silent spells without using higher-level spell slots.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time a character takes the feat, the spells of his or her next three lowest spell levels can now be silenced with no adjustment to their spell slots. This feat doesn't increase the casting time for those spells that normally become full-round actions when cast in metamagic form. However, since bard spells can't be enhanced with the Silent Spell feat, they can't be affected by this feat either.

name: Automatic Still Spell
prerequisite: Still Spell, Spellcraft 27 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level arcane or divine spells.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character may cast all 0-, 1st-, 2nd-, and 3rd-level spells as stilled spells without using higher-level spell slots.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time a character takes the feat, the spells of his or her next three lowest spell levels can now be stilled with no adjustment to their spell slots. This feat doesn't increase the casting time for those spells that normally become full-round actions when cast in metamagic form.

name: Bane of Enemies
prerequisite: Survival 24 ranks, five or more favored enemies.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Any weapon the character wields against one of his or her favored enemies is treated as a bane weapon for that creature type (thus, its enhancement bonus is increased by +2 and it deals +2d6 points of damage). This ability doesn't stack with similar abilities.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Blinding Speed
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can act as if <i>hasted</i> for 5 rounds each day. The duration of the effect need not be consecutive rounds. Activating this power is a free action.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time he or she takes the feat, it grants an additional 5 rounds of haste per day.

name: Bonus Domain
choice: An additional domain from the character's deity's domain list
prerequisite: Wis 21, ability to cast 9th-level divine spells.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Choose an additional domain from the character's deity's domain list. The character now has access to that domain's spells as normal for his or her domain spells and the domain's granted powers.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time he or she takes the feat, it applies to a different domain.

name: Bulwark of Defense
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's defensive stance bonuses increase to +4 Strength, +6 Constitution, +4 resistance bonus on all saves, and +6 dodge bonus to AC.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Chaotic Rage
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Any weapon the character wields while in a rage is treated as an anarchic weapon (it is chaos-aligned and deals an extra 2d6 points of damage against creatures of lawful alignment). This ability does not stack with similar abilities.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Colossal Wild Shape
prerequisite: The ability to wild shape into a Gargantuan creature.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can use his or her <i>wild shape</i> to take the shape of a Colossal animal.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, a character cannot wild shape into an animal of greater than Huge size.

name: Combat Archery
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character does not incur any attacks of opportunity for firing a bow when threatened.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, a character incurs an attack of opportunity from all opponents who threaten him or her whenever he or she uses a bow.

name: Craft Epic Magic Arms and Armor
prerequisite: Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Knowledge (arcana) 28 ranks, Spellcraft 28 ranks.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can craft magic arms and armor which exceed the normal limits for such items</p><p/>
</div>

name: Craft Epic Rod
prerequisite: Craft Rod, Knowledge (arcana) 32 ranks, Spellcraft 32 ranks.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can craft rods that exceed the normal limits for such items.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Craft Epic Staff
prerequisite: Craft Staff, Knowledge (arcana) 35 ranks, Spellcraft 35 ranks.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can craft staffs that exceed the normal limits for such items.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Craft Epic Wondrous Item
prerequisite: Craft Wondrous Item, Knowledge (arcana) 26 ranks, Spellcraft 26 ranks.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can craft wondrous items that exceed the normal limits for such items.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Damage Reduction
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character gains damage reduction 3/-. This does not stack with damage reduction granted by magic items or nonpermanent magical effects, but it does stack with any damage reduction granted by permanent magical effects, class features, or this feat itself.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time he or she gains the feat, his or her damage reduction increases by 3.

name: Deafening Song
prerequisite: Perform 24 ranks, bardic music class feature.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can use song or poetics to temporarily deafen all enemies within a 30-foot spread from him or her. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + 1/2 the character's class level + the character's Charisma modifier) negates the effect. The deafening effect lasts for as long as the character continues the deafening song. The character can choose to exclude any characters from this effect. The character may sing, play, or recite a deafening song while taking other mundane actions, but not magical ones (see the bard's inspire courage ability for more details). The character may keep up the deafening song for a maximum of 10 rounds. Using the deafening song counts as one of the character's uses of song or poetics for the day.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Death of Enemies
prerequisite: Bane of Enemies, Survival 30 ranks, five or more favored enemies.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Any time the character scores a critical hit against one of his or her favored enemies, it must make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + 1/2 character's ranger class level + character's Wisdom modifier) or die instantly.</p>
</div>
special: Creatures immune to critical hits can't be affected by this feat.

name: Devastating Critical
prerequisite: Str 25, Cleave, Great Cleave, Improved Critical (chosen weapon), Overwhelming Critical (chosen weapon), Power Attack, Weapon Focus (chosen weapon).
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Whenever the character scores a critical hit with the chosen weapon, the target must make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + 1/2 character level + character's Strength modifier) or die instantly. (Creatures immune to critical hits can't be affected by this feat.)</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time a character takes the feat, it applies to a different type of weapon.

name: Dexterous Fortitude
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Once per round, when targeted by an effect that requires a Fortitude saving throw, the character may make a Reflex save instead to avoid the effect (evasion is not applicable).</p><p/>
</div>

name: Dexterous Will
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Once per round, when targeted by an effect that requires a Will saving throw, the character may make a Reflex save instead to avoid the effect (evasion is not applicable).</p><p/>
</div>

name: Diminutive Wild Shape
prerequisite: Ability to wild shape into a Huge animal.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can use <i>wild shape</i> to take the shape of a Diminutive animal.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, a character cannot wild shape into an animal of smaller than Tiny size.

name: Dire Charge
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> If the character charges a foe during the first round of combat (or the surprise round, if the character is allowed to act in it), he or she can make a full attack against the opponent charged.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, a character may only make a single attack as part of a charge.

name: Distant Shot
prerequisite: Dex 25, Far Shot, Point Blank Shot, Spot 20 ranks.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character may throw or fire a ranged weapon at any target within line of sight, with no penalty for range.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Dragon Wild Shape
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character may use <i>wild shape</i> to change into a dragon (black, blue, green, red, white, brass, bronze, copper, gold, or silver). The size limitation is the same as the character's limitation on animal size. The character gains all extraordinary and supernatural abilities of the dragon whose form he or she takes.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Efficient Item Creation
prerequisite: Item creation feat to be selected, Knowledge (arcana) 24 ranks, Spellcraft 24 ranks.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Select an item creation feat. Creating a magic item using that feat requires one day per 10,000 gp of the item's market price, with a minimum of one day.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, creating a magic item requires one day for each 1,000 gp of the item's market price.
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time a character takes the feat, it applies to a different item creation feat.

name: Energy Resistance
choice: A type of energy (acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic)
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Choose a type of energy (acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic). The character gains resistance 10 to that type of energy, or the character's existing resistance to that type of energy increases by 10. This feat does not stack with energy resistance granted by magic items or nonpermanent magical effects.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. If the same type of energy is chosen, the effects stack.

name: Enhance Spell
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The damage cap for the character's spells increases by 10 dice (for spells that deal a number of dice of damage equal to caster level) or by 5 dice (for spells that deal a number of dice of damage equal to half caster level). An enhanced spell uses up a spell slot four levels higher than the spell's actual level. This feat has no effect on spells that don't specifically deal a number of dice of damage equal to the caster's level or half level, even if the spell's effect is largely dictated by the caster's level.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, use the damage dice caps indicated in the spell's description.
special: A character may gain this feat multiple times. Each time he or she selects this feat, the damage cap increases by 10 dice or 5 dice, as appropriate to the spell, and the enhanced spell takes up a spell slot an additional four levels higher.

name: Epic Dodge
prerequisite: Dex 25, Dodge, Tumble 30 ranks, improved evasion, defensive roll class feature.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Once per round, when struck by an attack from an opponent the character has designated as the object of his or her dodge, the character may automatically avoid all damage from the attack.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Epic Endurance
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Whenever the character makes a check for performing a physical action that extends over a period of time, he or she gets a +10 bonus on the check.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Epic Expanded Knowledge
choice: Any power, even one that is part of another discipline's list or another class's list
prerequisite: Character level 21st, ability to manifest powers of the normal maximum power level in at least one psionic class.
benefit:
<p>You learn another power.</p><div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> You learn one additional power at any level up to the highest level of power you can manifest. You can choose any power, even one that is part of another discipline's list or another class's list.</p>
</div>
special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Each time, you learn one new power at any level up to the highest level of power you can manifest.

name: Epic Fortitude
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character gains a +4 bonus on all Fortitude saving throws.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Epic Inspiration
prerequisite: Cha 25, Perform 30 ranks, bardic music class feature.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> All competence bonuses, dodge bonuses, and morale bonuses granted by the character's bardic music ability increase by +1.  If you have the inspire greatness bardic music ability, it grants one additional bonus HD.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Epic Leadership
normal: The Leadership feat provides no benefit for leadership scores beyond 25.

name: Epic Prowess
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Gain a +1 bonus on all attacks.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Epic Psionic Focus
prerequisite: Character level 21st, ability to manifest powers of the normal maximum power level in at least one psionic class.
benefit:
<p>You can expend your psionic focus to greater effect.</p><div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> When you expend your psionic focus, you can simultaneously use two feats that require a psionic focus to be expended, instead of just one. The feats must be stackable. You must still spend the requisite power points required to use each metapsionic feat, and you cannot exceed the power point limit set by your manifester level.</p>
</div>
special: You can take this feat multiple times. Each time you do so, you can simultaneously use one additional feat that requires a psionic focus to be expended.

name: Epic Reflexes
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character gains a +4 bonus on all Reflex saving throws.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Epic Reputation
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character gains a +4 bonus on Bluff, Diplomacy, Gather Information, Intimidate, and Perform checks.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Epic Skill Focus
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character gains a +10 bonus on all skill checks with that skill.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time a character takes the feat, it applies to a different skill.

name: Epic Speed
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's speed increases by 30 feet. This benefit does not stack with increased speed granted by magic items or nonpermanent magical effects.</p>
</div>
special: This feat only functions when the character is wearing medium armor, light armor, or no armor.

name: Epic Spell Focus
prerequisite: Greater Spell Focus and Spell Focus in the school selected, ability to cast at least one 9th-level spell of the school to be chosen.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells from the school of magic the character selects to focus on. This stacks with the bonuses from Spell Focus and Greater Spell Focus.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time the character takes the feat, it applies to a different school of magic.

name: Epic Spell Penetration
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character gets a +2 bonus on caster level checks to beat a creature's spell resistance. This stacks with the bonuses from Spell Penetration and Greater Spell Penetration.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Epic Spellcasting
prerequisite: Spellcraft 24 ranks, Knowledge (arcana) 24 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level arcane spells. OR Spellcraft 24 ranks, Knowledge (religion) 24 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level divine spells. OR Spellcraft 24 ranks, Knowledge (nature) 24 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level divine spells.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character may develop and cast epic spells.  If the character is an arcane spellcaster, he or she may cast a number of epic spells per day equal to his or her ranks in Knowledge (arcana) divided by 10. If the character is a divine spellcaster, he or she may cast a number of epic spells per day equal to his or her ranks in Knowledge (religion) or Knowledge (nature) divided by 10.</p>
</div>
special: If the character meets more than one set of prerequisites, the limit on the number of spells he or she may cast per day is cumulative.

name: Epic Toughness
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character gains +30 hit points.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Epic Weapon Focus
prerequisite: Weapon Focus in the chosen weapon.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Add a +2 bonus to all attack rolls the character makes using the selected weapon.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time the character takes the feat it applies to a different type of weapon.

name: Epic Weapon Specialization
prerequisite: Epic Weapon Focus, Weapon Focus, Weapon Specialization (all in the chosen weapon).
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Add +4 to all damage the character deals using the selected weapon. If the weapon is a ranged weapon, the damage bonus only applies if the target is within 30 feet.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time the character takes the feat, it applies to a different type of weapon.

name: Epic Will
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character gains a +4 bonus on all Will saving throws.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Exceptional Deflection
prerequisite: Dex 21, Wis 19, Deflect Arrows, Improved Unarmed Strike.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can deflect any ranged attacks (including spells that require ranged touch attacks) as if they were arrows.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Extended Life Span
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Add one-half the maximum result of the character's race's maximum age modifier to the character's normal middle age, old, and venerable age categories. Calculate the character's maximum age using the new venerable number. This feat can't lower the character's current age category.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Familiar Spell
choice: One arcane spell the character knows of 8th level or lower
prerequisite: Int 25 (if the character's spellcasting is controlled by Intelligence) or Cha 25 (if the character's spellcasting is controlled by Charisma).
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Choose one arcane spell the character knows of 8th level or lower. The character's familiar can now use this spell once per day as a spell-like ability, at a caster level equal to the character's caster level. A character cannot bestow a spell to his or her familiar if the spell normally has a material component cost of more than 1 gp or an XP cost.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time the character takes the feat, he or she can give his or her familiar a different spell-like ability or another daily use of the same spell-like ability.

name: Fast Healing
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character gains fast healing 3, or the character's existing fast healing increases by 3. This feat does not stack with fast healing granted by magic items or nonpermanent magical effects.</p>
</div>
special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Fine Wild Shape
prerequisite: Ability to wild shape into a Diminutive creature.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can use his or her <i>wild shape</i> to take the shape of a Fine animal.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, a character cannot wild shape into an animal smaller than Tiny size.

name: Forge Epic Ring
prerequisite: Forge Ring, Knowledge (arcana) 35 ranks, Spellcraft 35 ranks.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can forge magic rings that exceed the normal limits for such items.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Gargantuan Wild Shape
prerequisite: Ability to wild shape into a Huge animal.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can use your <i>wild shape</i> to take the shape of a Gargantuan animal.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, a character cannot wild shape into an animal greater than Huge size.

name: Great Charisma
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's Charisma increases by 1 point.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Great Constitution
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's Constitution increases by 1 point.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Great Dexterity
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's Dexterity increases by 1 point.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Great Intelligence
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's Intelligence increases by 1 point.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Great Smiting
prerequisite: Cha 25, smite ability (from class feature or domain granted power).
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Whenever the character makes a successful smite attack, add twice the appropriate level to damage (rather than just the character's level).</p>
</div>
special: A character may select this feat multiple times. Its effects stack. Remember that two doublings equals a tripling, and so forth.

name: Great Strength
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's Strength increases by 1 point.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Great Wisdom
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's Wisdom increases by 1 point.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Group Inspiration
prerequisite: Perform 30 ranks, bardic music class feature.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The number of allies the character can affect with his or her inspire competence or inspire greatness bardic music ability doubles. When inspiring competence in multiple allies, the character can choose different skills to inspire for different allies.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack. Remember that two doublings equals a tripling, and so forth.

name: Hindering Song
prerequisite: Deafening Song, Perform 27 ranks, bardic music class feature.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can use song or poetics to hinder enemy spellcasters within a 30-foot spread from the character. To successfully cast a spell within this area, a spellcaster must make a Concentration check as if he or she were casting defensively, and all such checks have a penalty equal to half the character's level. The character can choose to exclude any characters from this effect. The character may sing, play, or recite a hindering song while taking other mundane actions, but not magical ones (see the bard's inspire courage ability for more details). The character may keep up the hindering song for a maximum of 10 rounds. Using the hindering song counts as one of the character's uses of song or poetics for the day.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Holy Strike
prerequisite: Smite evil class feature, any good alignment.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Any weapon the character wields is treated as a holy weapon (is good-aligned and deals an extra 2d6 points of damage against creatures of evil alignment). If the weapon already has an alignment, this feat has no effect on the weapon.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Ignore Material Components
prerequisite: Eschew Materials, Spellcraft 25 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level arcane or divine spells.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character may cast spells without any material components. This feat does not affect the need for a focus or divine focus.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Improved Alignment-Based Casting
choice: An alignment-based domain (Chaos, Evil, Good, or Law) to which the character has access
prerequisite: Access to domain of Chaos, Evil, Good, or Law, alignment must match domain chosen, ability to cast 9th-level divine spells.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Select an alignment-based domain (Chaos, Evil, Good, or Law) to which the character has access. The character casts spells with that alignment descriptor at +3 caster level.</p>
</div>
special: This benefit overrides (does not stack with) the granted powers of the Chaos, Evil, Good, and Law domains. A character may select this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time a character takes the feat, it applies to a different alignment-based domain to which the character has access.

name: Improved Arrow of Death
prerequisite: Dex 19, Wis 19, Point Blank Shot, Precise Shot, arrow of death class feature.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Add +2 to the DC of the character's arrows of death. This feat may be taken multiple times. Its effects stack.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Improved Aura of Courage
prerequisite: Cha 25, aura of courage class ability.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's aura of courage grants a +8 morale bonus on saving throws against fear effects.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Improved Aura of Despair
prerequisite: Cha 25, aura of despair class ability.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's aura of despair causes a -4 morale penalty on all saving throws.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Improved Combat Casting
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character doesn't incur attacks of opportunity for casting spells when threatened.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Improved Combat Reflexes
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> There is no limit to the number of attacks of opportunity the character can make in one round. (the character still can't make more than one attack of opportunity for a given oppertunity.)</p><p/>
</div>

name: Improved Darkvision
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The range of the character's darkvision doubles. This feat does not stack with darkvision granted by magic items or nonpermanent magical effects.</p>
</div>
special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Its effects stack. Remember that two doublings equals a tripling, and so on.

name: Improved Death Attack
prerequisite: Death attack class feature, sneak attack +5d6.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Add +2 to the DC of the character's death attack.</p>
</div>
special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Improved Elemental Wild Shape
prerequisite: Wis 25, ability to wild shape into an elemental.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's ability to <i>wild shape</i> into an elemental is expanded to include all elemental creatures (not just air, earth, fire, and water elementals) of any size that the character can take when using <i>wild shape</i> to become an animal. The character gains all extraordinary and supernatural abilities of the elemental whose form he or she takes.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, a character may only wild shape into a Small, Medium-size, or Large air, earth, fire, or water elemental.

name: Improved Favored Enemy
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Add +1 to the bonus on Bluff, Listen, Sense Motive, Spot, and Survival checks and damage rolls against all the character's favored enemies.</p>
</div>
special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Improved Heighten Spell
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> As Heighten Spell, but there is no limit to the level to which the character can heighten the spell.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, a spell can only be heightened to a maximum of 9th level.

name: Improved Ki Strike
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's unarmed strikes are treated as epic magic weapons for the purposes of damage reduction.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Improved Low-Light Vision
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The range of the character's low-light vision doubles. This feat does not stack with low-light vision granted by magic items or nonpermanent magical effects.</p>
</div>
special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Its effects stack. Remember that two doublings equals a tripling, and so on.

name: Improved Manifestation
prerequisite: Character level 21st, ability to manifest powers of the normal maximum power level in at least one psionic class.
benefit:
<p>You increase your power point reserve.</p><div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> When you select this feat, you gain 19 power points.</p>
</div>
special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Each time you do so, you gain an additional number of power points equal to your previous benefit +2.

name: Improved Manyshot
prerequisite: Dex 19, base attack bonus +21, Many-shot, Point Blank Shot, Rapid Shot
benefit:
<div topic="Benefits" level="8"><p><b>Benefits:</b> As Manyshot, but the number of arrows the character can fire is limited only by his or her base attack bonus (two arrows, plus one arrow for every 5 points of base attack bonus above +6).</p>
</div>
normal: With the Manyshot feat, the character is limited to a maximum of four arrows fired (when the character's base attack bonus is +16 or higher).
special: Regardless of the number of arrows the character fires, he or she only applies precision-based damage (such as sneak attack damage or the ranger's favored enemy bonus) once. If the character scores a critical hit, only one of the arrows deals critical damage (character's choice); all others deal normal damage.

name: Improved Metamagic
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The spell slot modifier of all the character's metamagic feats is reduced by one level, to a minimum of +1. This feat has no effect on metamagic feats whose spell slot modifier is +1 or less.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. The effects stack, though a character can't reduce any metamagic feat's spell slot modifier to less than +1.

name: Improved Metapsionics
prerequisite: Character level 21st, four metapsionic feats, Psicraft 30 ranks.
benefit:
<p>You can manifest powers using metapsionic feats more easily than normal.</p><div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Metapsionic powers you manifest cost 2 power points less than normal (to a minimum of 1 power point).</p><p>This feat has no effect on metapsionic powers that inflate the cost by only 2 power points.</p>
</div>
special: You can gain this feat multiple times. The effects stack, though you can't lower the cost of any metapsionic power to less than 1 power point.

name: Improved Sneak Attack
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Add +1d6 to the character's sneak attack damage.</p>
</div>
special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Improved Spell Capacity
choice: One spell slot per day of any level up to one level higher than the highest-level spell the character can already cast in a particular class
prerequisite: Ability to cast spells of the normal maximum spell level in at least one spellcasting class.
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times.

name: Improved Spell Resistance
prerequisite: Must have spell resistance from a feat, class feature, or other permanent effect.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's spell resistance increases by +2.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Improved Stunning Fist
prerequisite: Dex 19, Wis 19, Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning Fist.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Add +2 to the DC of the character's stunning attack.</p>
</div>
special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Improved Whirlwind Attack
prerequisite: Int 13, Dex 23, Combat Expertise, Dodge, Mobility, Spring Attack, Whirlwind Attack.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> As a standard action, the character can make one melee attack for every five points of his or her base attack bonus (including epic attack bonus, round fractions down).</p><p>The character cannot attack any one opponent more than once as part of this action.  These attacks (as well as all other attacks made until the start of the character's next turn) suffer a -4 penalty.</p><p>When using the Improved Whirlwind feat, the character also forfeits any bonus or extra attacks granted by other spells or abilities (such as Cleave or the haste spell).</p><p>Since these attacks are made as part of a standard action the character can't make a 5-foot step between any two of the attacks.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, using the Whirlwind Attack feat requires a full attack action, and the character can take a 5-foot step between any two of the attacks.

name: Incite Rage
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> When the character enters a rage, he or she can incite a barbarian rage in any or all allies within 60 feet. (Any ally who doesn't wish to become enraged is unaffected.) The ally gains +4 to Strength, +4 to Constitution, and a +2 morale bonus on Will saves, but takes a -2 penalty to AC, for as long as the character remains raging. The rage of affected allies lasts a number of rounds equal to 3 + their Constitution modifier, regardless of whether they remain within 60 feet of the character. This is otherwise identical with normal barbarian rage (including the fatigue at its end).</p>
</div>

name: Infinite Deflection
prerequisite: Dex 25, Combat Reflexes, Deflect Arrows, Improved Unarmed Strike.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character may perform any number of deflections each round, as the Deflect Arrows feat.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Inspire Excellence
prerequisite: Perform 30 ranks, bardic music class feature.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can use song or poetics to grant a bonus to one ability score to his or her allies. To be affected, an ally must hear the bard sing for 1 full round. The effect lasts as long as the bard sings and for 5 rounds after the bard stops singing (or 5 rounds after the ally can no longer hear the bard). While singing, the bard can fight but cannot cast spells, activate magic items by spell completion (such as scrolls), or activate magic items by command word (such as wands). Each ally to be inspired gains a +4 competence bonus to the same ability score, which the character must choose before he or she begins inspiring. Inspire excellence is a supernatural, mind-affecting ability. Use of this feat counts as one of the character's bardic music uses for the day.</p>
</div>
special: This feat is treated as a bardic music inspiration ability for purposes of feats that affect such abilities.

name: Instant Reload
prerequisite: Quick Draw, Rapid Reload, Weapon Focus (crossbow type to be selected).
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character may fire the selected type of crossbow at his or her full normal attack rate. Reloading the crossbow does not provoke attacks of opportunity.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time a character takes the feat, it applies to a different type of crossbow.

name: Intensify Spell
prerequisite: Empower Spell, Maximize Spell, Spellcraft 30 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level arcane or divine spells.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> All variable, numeric effects of an intensified spell are maximized, then doubled. An intensified spell deals twice maximum damage, cures twice the maximum number of hit points, affects twice the maximum number of targets, and so forth, as appropriate. Saving throws and opposed rolls are not affected. An intensified spell uses up a spell slot seven levels higher than the spell's actual level. A character can't combine the effects of this feat with any other feat that affects the variable, numeric effects of a spell.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Keen Strike
prerequisite: Str 23, Wis 23, Improved Critical (unarmed strike), Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning fist, ki strike (adamantine).
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's unarmed strike has a critical threat range of 18-20 and deals slashing damage (at the character's option any attack can deal bludgeoning damage, but cannot then take advantage of the enhanced threat range). This ability doesn't stack with other abilities that expand that character's unarmed strike's threat range.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Lasting Inspiration
prerequisite: Perform 25 ranks, bardic music class feature.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The effects of the character's bardic music inspiration abilities last for ten times as long as normal after he or she stops singing. This feat has no effect on inspiration abilities that have no duration after the character stops singing.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Legendary Climber
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can ignore any check penalties applied for accelerated climbing or rapid climbing.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, a character takes a -5 penalty on Climb checks when attempting to cover his or her full speed in climbing distance in a round, or a -20 penalty when attempting to cover twice his or her speed in climbing distance in a round.

name: Legendary Commander
prerequisite: Cha 25, Epic Leadership, Leadership, Diplomacy 30 ranks, must rule own kingdom and have a stronghold.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Multiply the number of followers of each level that the character can lead by 10. This has no effect on cohorts.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Legendary Leaper
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character need only move 5 feet in a straight line to make a running jump.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, a character must move at least 20 feet in a straight line before attempting a running jump.

name: Legendary Rider
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character doesn't take a penalty on Ride checks when riding a mount without a saddle (bareback).  The character never needs to make a Ride check to control a mount in combat (and even controlling a mount not trained for combat doesn't require an action).</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, a character takes a -5 penalty on Ride checks without a saddle, and must make a Ride check to control a mount in combat (and controlling a mount not trained for combat requires a move action).

name: Legendary Tracker
prerequisite: Wis 25, Track, Knowledge (nature) 30 ranks, Survival 30 ranks.

name: Legendary Wrestler
prerequisite: Str 21, Dex 21, Improved Unarmed Strike, Escape Artist 15 ranks.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character gains a +10 bonus on all grapple checks.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Lingering Damage
prerequisite: Sneak attack +8d6, crippling strike class feature.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Any time the character deals damage with a sneak attack, that target takes damage equal to the character's sneak attack bonus damage on the character's next turn as well.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Magical Beast Companion
special: Creatures marked with an asterisk are available only in an aquatic environment.

name: Magical Beast Wild Shape
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can use his or her normal <i>wild shape</i> ability to take the form of a magical beast. The size limitation is the same as the character's limitation on animal size. The character gains all supernatural abilities of the magical beast whose form he or she takes.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Master Staff
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> When the character activates a staff, he or she can substitute a spell slot instead of using a charge. The spell slot must be one the character ahs not used for the day, though the character may lose a prepared spell to emulate a wand charge (the character may not lose prepared spells from his or her school of specialty, if any). The spell slot lost must be equal to or higher in level than the specific spell stored in the staff, including any level-increasing metamagic enhancements. A character cannot emulate a charge for a staff function that does not match a specific spell.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Master Wand
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> When the character activates a wand, he or she can substitute a spell slot instead of using a charge. The spell slot must be one the character has not used for the day, though he or she may lose a prepared spell to emulate a wand charge (the character may not lose prepared spells from his or her school of specialty, if any). The spell slot lost must be equal to or higher in level than the spell stored in the wand, including any level-increasing metamagic enhancements.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Mighty Rage
prerequisite: Str 21, Con 21, greater rage class feature, rage 5/day.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> When the character rages, he or she gains a +8 bonus to Strength and Constitution and a +4 morale bonus on Will saves. (These bonuses replace the normal rage bonuses.)</p><p/>
</div>

name: Mobile Defense
prerequisite: Dex 15, Dodge, Mobility, Spring Attack, defensive stance 3/day class feature.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> While in a defensive stance, the character may take one 5-foot adjustment each round without losing the benefits of the stance.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, a character can't move while in a defensive stance.

name: Multispell
prerequisite: Quicken Spell, ability to cast 9th-level arcane or divine spells.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character may cast one additional quickened spell in a round.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

name: Multiweapon Rend
prerequisite: Dex 15, base attack bonus +9, three or more hands, Multiweapon Fighting.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> If the character hits an opponent with two or more weapons (wielded in different hands) in the same round, he or she may automatically rend the opponent. This rending deals additional damage equal to the base damage of the smallest weapon that hit plus 1 1/2 times the character's Strength modifier. The character can only rend once per round, regardless of how many successful attacks he or she makes.</p>
</div>
special: This feat replaces the Two-Weapon Rend feat for creatures with more than two arms.

name: Music of the Gods
prerequisite: Cha 25, Perform 30 ranks, bardic music class feature.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's bardic music can affect even those normally immune to mind-affecting effects. However, such creatures gain a +10 bonus on their Will saves to resist such effects.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Negative Energy Burst
prerequisite: Cha 25, ability to rebuke or command undead, ability to cast inflict critical wounds, any evil alignment.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can use one rebuke or command undead attempt to unleash a wave of negative energy in a 60-foot-burst. Roll a normal rebuke (or command) check, except that the negative energy burst affects living creatures rather than undead. Any creature that would be rebuked by this result gains one negative level. Any creature that would be commanded by this check gains two negative levels. The Fortitude save DC to remove these levels one day later is equal to 10 + 1/2 the character's effective turning level + the character's Charisma modifier.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Overwhelming Critical
prerequisite: Str 23, Cleave, Great Cleave, Improved Critical (chosen weapon), Power Attack, Weapon Focus (chosen weapon).
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> When using the weapon the character has selected, he or she deals an extra 1d6 points of bonus damage on a successful critical hit. If the weapon's critical multiplier is x3, add +2d6 points of bonus damage instead, and if the multiplier is x4, add +3d6 points of bonus damage instead. Creatures immune to critical hits can't be affected by this feat.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time a character takes the feat, it applies to a different type of weapon.

name: Penetrate Damage Reduction
choice: A special material, such as adamantine
benefit:
<p>Select a special material, such as adamantine.</p><div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character melee weapons (including natural weapons) are treated as being crafted from the chosen special material for the purposes of bypassing the damage reduction of any creature the character strikes. None of the other special properties of special materials are gained by the character's melee weapons.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time the feat is selected the character selects a different special material. The character's melee attacks are treated as being crafted of all chosen materials for the purposes of bypassing damage reduction.

name: Perfect Health
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character is immune to all nonmagical diseases, as well as to all poisons whose Fortitude save DC is 25 or less.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Perfect Multiweapon Fighting
prerequisite: Dex 25, three or more hands, Greater Multiweapon Fighting, Multiweapon Fighting.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can make as many attacks with each extra weapon as with his or her primary weapon, using the same base attack bonus. The character still takes the normal penalties for fighting with two weapons.</p>
</div>
normal: A creature without this feat can make only one attack per round with each extra weapon (or two attacks per round with each weapon if it has Multiweapon Fighting, or three attacks per round with each extra weapon if it has Greater Multiweapon Fighting). Each attack after the first extra attack has a cumulative -5 penalty.
special: This feat replaces the Perfect Two-Weapon Fighting feat for creatures with more than two arms.

name: Perfect Two-Weapon Fighting
prerequisite: Dex 25, Greater Two-Weapon Fighting, Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, Two-Weapon Fighting.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can make as many attacks with his or her off-hand weapon as with his or her primary weapon, using the same base attack bonus. The character still takes the normal penalties for fighting with two weapons.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, a character can only get a single attack with an off-hand weapon (or two attacks with an off-hand weapon if he or she has Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, or three attacks with an off-hand weapon if he or she has Greater Two-Weapon Fighting).

name: Permanent Emanation
choice: A different spell to become permanent
prerequisite: Spellcraft 25 ranks, ability to cast the spell to be made permanent.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Designate any one of the character's spells whose area is an emanation from the character. This spell's effect is permanent (though the character can dismiss or restart it as a free action). Effects that would normally dispel this spell instead suppress it for 2d4 rounds.</p>
</div>
special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Each time, select a different spell to become permanent.

name: Planar Turning
prerequisite: Wis 25, Cha 25, ability to turn or rebuke undead.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can turn or rebuke outsiders as if they were undead. An outsider has effective turn resistance equal to half its spell resistance (round down). If the character can turn undead, he or she turns (or destroys) all evil outsiders and rebukes (or commands) all nonevil outsiders. If the character can rebuke undead, he or she rebukes (or commands) all evil outsiders and turns (or destroys) all nonevil outsiders.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Plant Wild Shape
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can use his or her normal <i>wild shape</i> ability to take the form of a plant. The size limitation is the same as the character's limitation on animal size.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Polyglot
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can speak all languages. If the character is literate, he or she can also read and write all languages (not including magical script).</p><p/>
</div>

name: Positive Energy Aura
prerequisite: Cha 25, ability to turn undead, ability to cast dispel evil.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Every undead creature that comes within 15 feet of the character is automatically affected as if the character had turned it. This doesn't cost a turning attempt, and the character doesn't have to roll turning damage (it automatically affects all undead in a 15-foot burst), but it only turns undead with Hit Dice equal to or less than the character's effective cleric level minus 10 (and automatically destroys undead with Hit Dice equal to or less than the character's effective cleric level minus 20). Just as with normal turning, the character can't affect undead that have total cover relative to him or her.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Power Knowledge
choice: Two new powers at any level up to the highest level of power you can manifest
prerequisite: Character level 21st, ability to manifest powers of the normal maximum power level in at least one psionic class.
benefit:
<p>You add two additional powers to your list of powers known.</p><div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> You learn two new powers of any level up to the highest level of power you can manifest. The powers you select must be on your class list or the list for your discipline.</p>
</div>
special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Each time, you learn two new powers at any level up to the highest level of power you can manifest.

name: Psicrystal Power
choice: One power you know of 8th level or lower
prerequisite: Character level 21st, Intelligence 25 or Charisma 25 (depending on which is your key ability score for manifesting).
benefit:
<p>Your psicrystal can manifest a power.</p><div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Choose one power you know of 8th level or lower. Your psicrystal can now manifest this power once per day at your manifester level (the psicrystal gains sufficient power points to manifest the power once). You cannot bestow a power upon your psicrystal if the power normally has any experience point cost.</p>
</div>
special: You can gain this feat multiple times. Each time you take the feat, you can give your psicrystal knowledge of a new power (and it gains sufficient power points to manifest that power once).All power points gained by a psicrystal from multiple applications of this feat go into its reserve and can be used to manifest the powers it knows as you desire.

name: Ranged Inspiration
prerequisite: Bardic music class feature, Perform 25 ranks
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Double the range of any bardic music ability that has a range. (If the creature must hear the bard to be affected by the ability, that requirement doesn't change regardless of any extended range the bard's ability may have.)</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack. Remember that two doublings equals a tripling, and so forth.

name: Rapid Inspiration
prerequisite: Perform 25 ranks, bardic music class feature.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can use any of his or her bardic music inspiration abilities as a standard action. The inspiration takes effect immediately after the character concludes the action.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Reactive Countersong
prerequisite: Combat Reflexes, Perform 30 ranks, bardic music class feature.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can begin a countersong at any time, even when it isn't his or her turn (much like a wizard who has readied a counterspell action), though the character doesn't have to ready an action to do so. The character can't use Reactive Countersong at the same time he or she isusing another bardic music ability (though the character could stop the other bardic music ability to begin Reactive Countersong if so desired).</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, a character can only use counter-song on his or her turn.

name: Reflect Arrows
prerequisite: Dex 25, Deflect Arrows, Improved Unarmed Strike.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> When the character deflects an arrow or other ranged attack, the attack is reflected back upon the attacker at the character's base ranged attack bonus.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Righteous Strike
prerequisite: Wis 19, Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning Fist, any lawful alignment.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's unarmed strike is treated as an axiomatic weapon (it is lawfully aligned and deals an extra 2d6 points of damage against creatures of chaotic alignment). This ability doesn't stack with similar abilities.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Ruinous Rage
prerequisite: Str 25, Improved Sunder, Power Attack, rage 5/day.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> While in a rage, the character ignores the hardness of any object he or she strikes. Also, double the character's Strength bonus for the purposes of any Strength check made to break an object with sudden force rather than by dealing normal damage (including bursting bindings, such as ropes or manacles).</p><p/>
</div>

name: Scribe Epic Scroll
prerequisite: Scribe Scroll, Knowledge (arcana) 24 ranks, Spellcraft 24 ranks.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can scribe scrolls that exceed the normal limits for such items. Even this feat does not allow the character to scribe a scroll with an epic spell.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Self-Concealment
prerequisite: Dex 30, Hide 30 ranks, Tumble 30 ranks, improved evasion.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Attacks against the character have a 10% miss chance, similar to the effect of concealment. The character loses this benefit whenever he or she would lose his or her Dexterity bonus to AC.</p>
</div>
special: This feat may be taken multiple times. Each time it is taken, the miss chance increases by 10% to a maximum of 50% after it has been taken five times.

name: Shattering Strike
prerequisite: Epic Weapon Focus (unarmed strike), Weapon Focus (unarmed strike), Concentration 25 ranks, ki strike (adamantine).
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> When using an unarmed strike to attempt to break an object with sudden force (rather than by dealing normal damage), make a Concentration check rather than a Strength check. The break DC remains the same. Using Shattering Strike is a full-round action that incurs attacks of opportunity. The character can't use Shattering Strike to escape bonds (unless he or she is so bound as to allow the character to make an unarmed strike against his or her bindings).</p><p/>
</div>

name: Sneak Attack of Opportunity
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Any attack of opportunity the character makes is considered a sneak attack.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Spectral Strike
prerequisite: Wis 19, ability to turn or rebuke undead.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's attacks deal damage normally against incorporeal creatures.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, even attacks that can damage an incorporeal creature have a 50% chance to deal no damage.

name: Spell Knowledge
choice: Two new arcane spells of any level up to the maximum level he or she can cast
prerequisite: Ability to cast spells of the maximum normal spell level of an arcane spellcasting class.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character learns two new arcane spells of any level up to the maximum level he or she can cast. This feat does not grant any additional spell slots.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times.

name: Spell Opportunity
prerequisite: Combat Casting, Combat Reflexes, Quicken Spell, Spellcraft 25 ranks.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Whenever the character is allowed an attack of opportunity, he or she may cast (and attack with) a touch spell as the character's attack of opportunity. This incurs attacks of opportunity just as if the character had cast the spell normally.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, a character can only make a melee attack as an attack of opportunity.

name: Spell Stowaway
choice: A spell-like ability the character knows, or a spell the character cam cast
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Choose a spell-like ability the character knows, or a spell the character cam cast.  The character is attuned to the magic he or she chooses. If another spellcaster within 300 feet of the character uses this magic, the character also immediately gains the magic's effect as if it had been used on the character by the same caster. The character must have direct line of effect to the spellcaster in order to gain the benefit of the attuned magic (though the character does not have to know the spellcaster is present, and he or she can be flat-footed). The magic's duration, effect, and other specifics are determined by its original caster's level.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time a character takes the feat, it applies to a different spell or spell-like ability.

name: Spellcasting Harrier
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Any spellcaster the character threatens in melee provokes an attack of opportunity if he or she tries to cast defensively.  The character gets a +4 bonus on this attack roll.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Spontaneous Domain Access
choice: A domain the character has access to
prerequisite: Wis 25, Spellcraft 30 ranks, ability to cast 9th-level divine spells.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Select a domain the character has access to. The character may spontaneously convert any prepared cleric spell (except a domain spell) into a domain spell of the same level in the selected domain, just as a cleric channels energy to convert spells into <i>cure</i> spells.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time a character takes the feat, it applies to a different domain.

name: Spontaneous Spell
choice: A spell the character can cast
prerequisite: Spellcraft 25 ranks, ability to cast the maximum normal spell level of at least one spell-casting class.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Select a spell the character can cast. The character may spontaneously convert any prepared spell of the selected spell's level into the selected spell, just as a cleric channels energy to convert spells into <i>cure</i> spells.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time he or she takes the feat, it applies to a different spell.

name: Storm of Throws
prerequisite: Dex 23, Point Blank Shot, Quick Draw, Rapid Shot.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> As a full-round action, the character may throw a light weapon at his or her full base attack bonus at each opponent within 30 feet. All light weapons thrown need not be the same type.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Superior Initiative
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character gets a +8 bonus on initiative checks. This bonus overlaps (does not stack with) the bonus from Improved Initiative.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Swarm of Arrows
prerequisite: Dex 23, Point Blank Shot, Rapid Shot, Weapon Focus (type of bow used).
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> As a full-round action, the character may fire an arrow at his or her full base attack bonus at each opponent within 30 feet.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Terrifying Rage
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> While you are raging, any enemy that views you must make a Will save opposed by your Intimidate check of become panicked (if it have HD less than your character level) or shaken (if it has HD equal to or up to twice your character level) for 4d6 rounds.  An enemy with Hit Dice greater than twice your character level is not affected by this feat.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Tenacious Magic
choice: One spell the character knows or spell-like ability the character possesses
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Choose one spell the character knows or spell-like ability the character possesses. Whenever the chosen form of magic would otherwise end due to a <i>dispel</i> effect, the magic is instead only suppressed for 1d4 rounds. The magic still ends when its duration expires, but the suppressed rounds do not count against its duration. The character can dismiss his or her own spell or spell-like ability (if dismissible) or dispel his or her own tenacious magic normally.</p>
</div>
special: A character can gain this feat multiple times. Each time he or she takes the feat, it applies to a different spell or spell-like ability.

name: Thundering Rage
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Any weapon the character wields while in a rage is treated as a thundering weapon. The DC of the Fortitude save to resist deafness is equal to 10 + 1/2 the character's level. This ability does not stack with similar abilities.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Trap Sense
prerequisite: Search 25 ranks, Spot 25 ranks, trapfinding class ability.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> If the character passes within 5 feet of a trap, he or she is entitled to a Search check to notice it as if the character was actively looking for it.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Two-Weapon Rend
prerequisite: Dex 15, base attack bonus +9, Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, Two-Weapon Fighting.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> If the character hits an opponent with a weapon in each hand in the same round, he or she may automatically rend the opponent. This deals additional damage equal to the base damage of the smaller weapon plus 1 1/2 times the character's Strength modifier. Base weapon damage includes an enhancement bonus on damage, if any. The character can only rend once per round, regardless of how many successful attacks he or she makes.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Uncanny Accuracy
prerequisite: Dex 21, base attack bonus +11, Point Blank Shot, Precise Shot, Improved Precise Shot, Spot 20 ranks.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's ranged attacks ignore the miss chance granted to targets by total concealment.  The character must aim his or her attacks at the correct square to gain advantage of this feat.</p>
</div>
normal: Without this feat, characters suffer a 50% miss chance when making a ranged attack against a target with total concealment.
special: A character with at least 11 levels of ranger can qualify for this feat even if he or she does not have the prerequisites for it, but can only use it when wearing light or no armor.

name: Undead Mastery
prerequisite: Cha 21, ability to rebuke or command undead.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character may command up to ten times his or her level in HD of undead.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Unholy Strike
prerequisite: Smite good class feature, any evil alignment.
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> Any weapon the character wields is treated as an unholy weapon (it is evil-aligned and deals an extra 2d6 points of damage against creatures of good alignment). This ability doesn't stack with similar abilities. If the weapon already has an alignment, this feat has no effect on the weapon.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Vermin Wild Shape
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character can use his or her normal <i>wild shape</i> ability to take the form of a vermin. The size limitation is the same as the character's limitation on animal size.</p><p/>
</div>

name: Vorpal Strike
prerequisite: Str 25, Wis 25, Improved Critical (unarmed strike), Improved Unarmed Strike, Keen Strike, Stunning Fist, ki strike (adamantine).
benefit:
<div topic="Benefit" level="8"><p><b>Benefit:</b> The character's unarmed strike is considered to be a slashing vorpal weapon. (At the character's option, any unarmed strike can do bludgeoning damage instead, but it loses the vorpal quality.) This ability doesn't stack with similar abilities</p><p/>
</div>

name: Widen Aura of Courage
